remarks: An infinite product of complex terms is a function from an upper set of integers to ` CC ` .  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 4-Dec-2017.)
statement:
prodf.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
prodf.2 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
prodf.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) e. CC ) $.
prodf $p |- ( ph -> seq M ( x. , F ) : Z --> CC ) $.
$d F k $.
$d M k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
